intro.paragraph1: We are a group of Christians that believe that the church, the home, and the school are the pillars of a well-rounded education for our children.

statementOfFaith.title: Statement of Faith
statementOfFaith.subtitle: Our theological foundation and beliefs
statementOfFaith.intro: These are the core theological beliefs that guide our school and shape our educational approach. They represent our understanding of God, humanity, salvation, and our calling as a Christian educational community.

beliefs.title: The Triune God
beliefs.content: We uphold that the Lord Our God is one – Father, Son, and Holy Spirit. This is the God we must Worship, Serve, Obey, and Give Thanks – in Spirit and Truth, with all our heart, with all our soul, with all our mind, and with all our strength.

beliefs.title: Humanity's Fallen Nature
beliefs.content: We affirm that we, as human beings, are sinful, dead in sin, incapable of self-salvation. We deserve death and separation from God for our rebellion and disobedience.

beliefs.title: God's Grace and Redemption
beliefs.content: We believe that God, by grace, does not impute sin to those who believe in His Son, Jesus Christ. Instead, through Christ's sacrifice, He reconciles us to Himself, forgiving our sins, delivering us from eternal death, and granting us eternal life.

beliefs.title: Jesus Christ Our Savior
beliefs.content: We trust that Jesus Christ, the Son of God, is our only Savior. Through His perfect life, sacrificial death, and glorious resurrection, He has accomplished everything necessary for our salvation. We can add nothing to His finished work.

beliefs.title: The Holy Spirit
beliefs.content: We recognize the Holy Spirit as God, who dwells in believers, empowering them to live godly lives, understand Scripture, and bear witness to Christ. The Spirit convicts of sin, regenerates hearts, and guides believers into all truth.

beliefs.title: The Authority of Scripture
beliefs.content: We uphold that the Old and New Testaments are the inspired, infallible, and authoritative Word of God. Scripture is our final authority for all matters of faith, doctrine, and Christian living.

beliefs.title: The Church
beliefs.content: We believe in the universal Church, the body of Christ, composed of all true believers. The local church is called to worship God, edify believers, administer the ordinances of baptism and communion, and proclaim the Gospel to the world.

beliefs.title: The Great Commission
beliefs.content: We are committed to fulfilling Christ's command to make disciples of all nations, teaching them to observe all that He commanded. This includes evangelism, discipleship, and Christian education as vital expressions of our faith.

beliefs.title: Love and Service to Our Neighbor
beliefs.content: We are called to love our neighbors as ourselves, demonstrating Christ's love through acts of service, compassion, and justice. Our faith must be expressed in practical love and good works, reflecting the character of our Savior.

statementOfFaith.closing: These beliefs form the foundation of everything we do at CEE, guiding our teaching, our relationships, and our service to students, families, and the community.

philosophy.title: Our Philosophy
philosophy.subtitle: The guiding principles of our educational approach
philosophy.intro: Our educational philosophy is built on the foundation that all wisdom and knowledge originate from God, revealed through His Word.

biblical.title: Biblical Foundation
biblical.content: We are convicted that all wisdom and knowledge have their origin in God, who reveals himself in His Word. The Bible is our pillar and authority for every principal integrated into our curriculum.

dignity.title: Human Dignity and Cultural Identity
dignity.content: It is our belief that in order for human beings to keep their dignity, they have to hold their manners, language, and belonging to their country in high esteem.

bilingual.title: Bilingual Excellence
bilingual.content: We believe that teaching a second language is a necessary tool, useful for the development of a child's future where they can be involved, in their own country as well as internationally, in search of a better future for themselves, society, and their country.

items.description: Every subject is taught through the lens of biblical truth and God's revelation

items.description: Building dignity through respect for language, culture, and national identity

history.title: History of the School
history.subtitle: Our journey from a dream to reality
history.intro: From humble beginnings in 1990, CEE has grown to become a cornerstone of Christian bilingual education in Siguatepeque.

late1980s.title: Late 1980s - A Dream is Born
late1980s.content: At the end of the 1980s, a group of parents in Siguatepeque identified the need for an educational institution that, in addition to upholding evangelical principles, would offer quality education with English language proficiency as a cultural and technical tool that would open doors of opportunity for the children and youth of our community.

early1990.title: Early 1990 - Building Support
early1990.content: At the beginning of the last decade of the 20th century, this aspiration was shared with a select group of parents, whose support was fundamental. After making the necessary contacts with an American teacher of extensive professional and spiritual merits, Professor Carol Livingston de Bardales, the decision was made to start Escuela Bilingüe Siguatepeque in August 1990.

august1990.title: August 1990 - Opening Day
august1990.content: The institution began its work with thirteen students in first and second grade. Professor Bardales assumed the direction and teaching of English, while the Spanish area was initially taught by Professor Rosita de Flores.

firstYears.title: First Years - Rented Facilities
firstYears.content: For a time, the school operated in rented classrooms in the building currently occupied by the Central American Biblical Seminary (SEBCAH).

mid1992.title: Mid-1992 - Our Permanent Home
mid1992.content: In mid-1992, we were able to acquire a house and the hangars of what had until then been the base of the venerable Wings of Mercy Mission.

present.title: Present Day - Serving Our Community
present.content: In this location, our educational institution currently operates, providing services at the preschool, elementary, and secondary education levels.

legacy.title: A Legacy of Excellence
legacy.content: From thirteen students to a thriving institution serving hundreds of families, CEE continues to fulfill the vision of its founders: providing Christ-centered, bilingual education that opens doors of opportunity for the children and youth of Siguatepeque.

cta.title: Be Part of Our Story
cta.description: Join the legacy of excellence and continue the tradition of quality Christian education.

intro.paragraph1: The school is located in the city of Siguatepeque in the heart of Honduras. The city is approximately 1200m (4000ft) above sea level and surrounded by lush, green mountains.

intro.title: Early Partial Immersion Program
intro.paragraph1: CEE is an early partial immersion program, which means that students learn through two languages (Spanish and English) from the time they begin kindergarten until the time they graduate from high school in the 11th grade.
intro.paragraph2: Approximately half of the students' classes are in Spanish and the other half of their classes are taught in English.

kindergarten.title: Kindergarten
kindergarten.name: Jardín Bilingüe Siguatepeque
kindergarten.description: Our kindergarten program serves students ages 4-5, providing a nurturing environment where young learners begin their journey in bilingual education. Through play-based learning and structured activities, children develop foundational skills in both languages.
kindergarten.details: We focus on social-emotional development, early literacy, numeracy skills, and building a love for learning in both Spanish and English.

elementary.title: Elementary School
elementary.name: Escuela Bilingüe Siguatepeque
elementary.description: Our elementary program (grades 1-6) builds a strong academic foundation through immersive bilingual instruction. Students engage in a comprehensive curriculum that develops critical thinking, problem-solving, and communication skills.

secondary.title: Secondary School
secondary.name: Instituto Bilingüe Siguatepeque
secondary.description: Our secondary program (grades 7-11) prepares students for higher education and professional success through rigorous academic coursework and continued bilingual development.

programs.title: Programs
programs.subtitle: Comprehensive educational programs for whole-child development
programs.intro: At CEE, we offer a wide range of academic, special, and extracurricular programs designed to develop students spiritually, academically, physically, and socially. Our programs provide opportunities for every student to discover their gifts and grow in excellence.

items.title: Early Childhood Education
items.description: Our early childhood program provides a nurturing, play-based learning environment where young children develop foundational skills in literacy, numeracy, social interaction, and spiritual formation. Through bilingual instruction, children begin their journey in both Spanish and English.
highlights: Fine and gross motor skill development

items.title: Elementary Education

items.title: Middle School

items.title: High School
items.description: Our high school program offers rigorous college-preparatory education with a biblical worldview. Students take advanced courses in sciences, mathematics, humanities, and electives while being equipped for university success and lifelong learning.

grades.title: Grades & Levels
grades.subtitle: Educational excellence from Pre-K through Grade 11
grades.intro: At CEE, we provide age-appropriate, bilingual education that grows with your child. Our program spans from early childhood through high school, with each level designed to build upon the previous one while meeting the unique developmental needs of students at each stage.

levels.title: Early Childhood
levels.description: Our early childhood program lays the foundation for lifelong learning in a nurturing, play-based environment. Children begin their bilingual journey through engaging activities that develop social, emotional, cognitive, and spiritual skills.

levels.title: Elementary School
levels.description: Elementary education at CEE builds a strong academic foundation through bilingual immersion. Students develop critical thinking skills, explore their creativity, and grow in their understanding of God's Word while mastering core subjects in both languages.

levels.title: Middle School
levels.description: Our middle school program supports students through critical developmental years with rigorous academics and spiritual guidance. Students deepen their bilingual proficiency while exploring subjects in greater depth and discovering their unique gifts and calling.

levels.title: High School
levels.description: CEE's high school program prepares students for university success and life beyond graduation. Through college-preparatory coursework, students develop academic excellence, leadership skills, and a biblical worldview that equips them to make a positive impact in their communities and the world.

items.title: Bilingual Immersion
items.description: Students learn through both Spanish and English from kindergarten through graduation, developing native-level proficiency in both languages.

items.title: Christ-Centered Learning
items.description: Biblical principles are woven throughout every subject, helping students develop a Christian worldview and strong moral character.

items.title: Individualized Support
items.description: Small class sizes and dedicated teachers ensure each student receives the attention and support they need to reach their full potential.

cta.title: Ready to Learn More?
cta.description: Discover how CEE's grade-level programs can provide your child with an excellent bilingual, Christ-centered education.
